4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:07): Is it possible to map a network share as a folder name on the current machine without using a drive letter, or UNC paths?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:08): As in a new drive letter.
3d0990a367ad2e0303ba139bfb276a15 (02:08): you want to map a network share as a folder
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:08): So maybe:    C:\shares\remotesharename\     Instead of T:\

dc1a0f12f1b4160a8a2f56b8a66da64c (02:08): question: If a network has IPP available, and I want to connect and install a printer, but their client is broken, I do not have the Iprint client installed on this pc, how can I connect to print from windows XP Pro?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:08): Is it possible?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:08): I know you can map local disks like this.
3d0990a367ad2e0303ba139bfb276a15 (02:09): yeah, you can
3d0990a367ad2e0303ba139bfb276a15 (02:10): I don't think you can with net use...
dc1a0f12f1b4160a8a2f56b8a66da64c (02:10): or is there another way to install Iprint client so I an connect?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:10): Subst only allows using a folder to become a drive letter.
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:10): Arrick, I dunno.  I try to avoid printing when possible.
dc1a0f12f1b4160a8a2f56b8a66da64c (02:11): I have to print for some of my classes

5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:11): For more info on the 'local service' and 'network service' accounts, see this: http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/topics/serversecurity/serviceaccount/sspgch02.mspx#ENG
dc1a0f12f1b4160a8a2f56b8a66da64c (02:12): I mean, I can open their novell server and everything, even pull up thier printer, but I cant seem to connect to print
29849471ca72e6e1db006fbb7449d59f (02:14): these questions are real-time?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:14): Is it possible to map a network share to a folder on a local disk?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:14): Like C:\TheirShareGoesHere
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:14): yes. share it out then map it
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:14): Like you can in Disk Manager for mapping a disk partition to a empty folder?
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:15): So example:    You want \\remotemachine\remoteshare
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:15): To become C:\TheirShareGoesHere
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:15): no.
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:15): So on your local machine, by going to C:\TheirShareGoesHere, you access those remote files.
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:15): Okay, just curious.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:15): ntfs junctions cannot, iirc, point to offsystem resources
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:15): I thought it would cut down on number of mapped drives.
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:16): i wonder how hard it would be to write a new FS that works with win32.
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:16): using the permissions that a *nix fS does.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:16): unix_infidel, the apis are there, google 'IFS' aka 'Installable File System'
821e9b3a4d40dbd7379e39bd17c4fc06 (02:16): question
4ff7d9bab0006756de2051a298c80706 (02:16): Isn't there a disk mounter that can mount extfs on NT?
821e9b3a4d40dbd7379e39bd17c4fc06 (02:16): what happens if you go past Z:\?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:16): the dude at fs-driver.org did just that
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:17): quux: so the question is, why is the support so iffy?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:17): torchie: you can't go past z:
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:17): support of what, unix_infidel?
821e9b3a4d40dbd7379e39bd17c4fc06 (02:17): that's all?
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:17): or rather, why cant you install win32 on ext3.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:17): other fs's?
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:17): sure.
29849471ca72e6e1db006fbb7449d59f (02:17): unix_infidel: because
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:18): Typically the problem seems to be around permissions
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:18): quux: i'm assuming permissions issues have nothing to do with the FS API.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:18): but I don't know of anyone who has documented an attempt to, say, use F6 to install the etx2/3 driver from fs-driver.org and then install windows to it
29849471ca72e6e1db006fbb7449d59f (02:19): what a nice idea
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:19): personally, I wouldn't see the point. Maybe someone else would.
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:20): quux: i suppose then what's the point of developing winfs.
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:20): maybe i dont know enough about ntfs
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:20): unix_infidel, that had the extremely valid point of expanding the FS's capabilities into new areas, for new usability functions
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:21): they have a KB article on it or a technet blog entry?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:21): on winfs?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:21): the winfs team had a blog. Not sure how much info is there
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:21): quux: features of ntfs vs. nix fs's.  And improvements winfs claims.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:22): unix_infidel, I spent some time looking into the issue
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:22): Mostly you see claims of higher/lower speed, or less fragmentation or some such
